Description: Temptation of a saint (St. Antony?); a group of figures around a table Oil, on brown paper
Curator's comments: The Tietzes reported that Tozzi connected this drawing with the series in this album representing the 'Temptation of St. Antony' (nos. 1907-7-17- 42 to 74) and with a painting of the same subject by Domenico Tintoretto in the Harrach collection in Vienna. While the subject could be that of the 'Temptation of St. Antony', the style and composition is very different from the above mentioned drawings and there is certainly no connection between this drawing and the Harrach painting, 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series. Lit.: S. Colvin, 'Tintoretto at the British Museum', 'The Burlington Magazine', XVI, 1910, pl. 3 (as Jacopo Tintoretto); R. Tozzi, 'Disegni di Domenico Tintoretto', "Bollettino d'Arte", 31, serie III, pp. 19-31, fig. 14; H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no. 1526/13, p. 264
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt (?)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
